page.title: 06Landscape/Bldngs Syerston.
page.content: Syerston is a small{cul-de-sac village half a mile from the Fosse Way. It consists of a road leading from the Fosse which splits into two village streets, both of which eventually become footpaths through fields. The area surrounding the village is gently undulating and now mostly devoted to arable farming. There are many attractive trees and fine hedges which line the village streets and approaches. This, combined with wide grass verges makes Syerston a pleasant rural village. Buildings are a mixture of old and new red brick with pantile roofs prevail. There are cottages dating from C17th. and four listed buildings. There are recent conversions from redundant buildings, modern houses and bungalows and a crescent of ex-RAF houses. There is a C13th Church, village hall and P.O.
